Laser

Contains logic for interacting with IPG Lasers **/ open subprog Laser(void) return;

Functions
Reset(void)

// check for any faults, try to clear, see if ok // start laser diodes // open all shutters local resetOK;

callsub sub.ClearFaults(); dwell0

return;

AbortNow
call Laser.AbortNow();

Stop pulsing, close the software shutter (which enables UI control).  Only does this if config flags are set to enable automatic control of diodes and shutters.

ClearFaults
call Laser.ClearFaults();

Command the laser to clear current faults.

SetControlMode
call Laser.SetControlMode(
value
);

Set the SPI Laser control mode

Parameters
value

the desired control mode

GetControlMode
call Laser.GetControlMode();

Get the SPI Laser control mode

TurnLaserOff
call Laser.TurnLaserOff();

Turn off the laser

EnableLaser
call Laser.EnableLaser();

Turn on the laser

SetLaserPowerAsPercentages

Set the laser power to a percentage of its maximum power

Parameters
value

the percentage of total laser power

See Also

  • Laser.SetPowerAsPercentage

StartLaser
call Laser.StartLaser();

Start the laser

SetActiveCurrentPercentage
call Laser.SetActiveCurrentPercentage(
value
);

Set the laser current to a percentage of its maximum current

Parameters
value

the percentage of total laser current

SetPowerAsPercentage
call Laser.SetPowerAsPercentage(
value
);

Set the laser power to a percentage of its maximum power

Parameters
value

the percentage of total laser power

See Also

  • Laser.SetLaserPowerAsPercentage

SetSimmerCurrent
call Laser.SetSimmerCurrent(
value
);

Set the laser simmer current

Parameters
value

the new simmer current

SetWaveform
call Laser.SetWaveform(
value
);

Set the laser wave form

Parameters
value

the new wave form

SetPulseRate
call Laser.SetPulseRate(
value
);

Set the laser pulse rate

Parameters
value

the new pulse rate

SetBurstLength
call Laser.SetBurstLength(
value
);

Set the laser burst length

Parameters
value

the new burst length

SetDutyFactor
call Laser.SetDutyFactor(
value
);

Set the laser duty factor

Parameters
value

the new duty factor

RestartPulseGenerator
call Laser.RestartPulseGenerator();

Restart the laser pulse generator

SetGateControl
call Laser.SetGateControl(
value
);

Set the laser gate control

Parameters
value

the new gate control

Note

Only applicable for Arges-integrated lasers

call Laser.SetGateDelay(
value
);

Set the laser gate delay

Parameters
value

the new gate delay

Note

Only applicable for Arges-integrated lasers

value
);

Parameters

the new fpk duration

value

Parameters

the new fpk inv time

SetFpkControl
call Laser.SetFpkControl(
value
);

Set the laser fpk control

Parameters
value

the new fpk control

Note

Only applicable for Arges-integrated lasers

isReady
call Laser.isReady(
&ready
);

Check that the laser is ready and not faulted.  Does not check if the laser is running, or if the shutters are open.  If LaserStartAndCheckDiodes is FALSE, this routine is ignored

Response Parameters
&ready

if the laser is ready, TRUE.  Otherwise, FALSE.

SetAndCheckReadyToFire
call Laser.SetAndCheckReadyToFire(
&ready
);

Set the laser to 'Ready To Fire' and verify state.

Response Parameters
&ready

if 1, ready. If 0, warming up.  If <0, an error has been detected.

HandleOverrideKeyOn

sub: HandleOverrideKeyOn(void) callsub sub.AbortNow(); if (LaserStartAndCheckDiodes == 1) callsub sub.SetLaserPowerAsPercentage(10); return;

/*** sub: Shutdown Shut down the laser diodes nicely

OpenAllShutters
call Laser.OpenAllShutters();

tell all shutters to open without waiting for completion

areAllShuttersOpen
call Laser.areAllShuttersOpen(
&isopen
);

Query to see if all shutters are open

Response Parameters
&isopen

if all shutters are open, 1.  Otherwise, 0.

OpenSoftwareShutter
call Laser.OpenSoftwareShutter();

Command the software shutter to open

CloseSoftwareShutter
call Laser.CloseSoftwareShutter();

Command the software shutter to close

IsFaultAndWarnOK
call Laser.IsFaultAndWarnOK(
&isOK
);

Query the laser status for faults and warnings

Response Parameters
&isOK

if the laser is OK, 1.  If there is an error, -1.  If there is a warning, -2.

TurnOnLaserDiodes
call Laser.TurnOnLaserDiodes();

Command the laser diodes to turn on

TurnOffLaserDiodes
call Laser.TurnOffLaserDiodes();

Command the laser diodes to turn off

GetLaserDiodesReadyToFire
call Laser.GetLaserDiodesReadyToFire(
&isready
);

Query to see if the diodes are in a ready-to-fire state

Response Parameters
&isready

if the diodes are ready, 1.  If the diodes are warming up, 0.  If there is an error, -1.

TurnOnLaserPulsing
call Laser.TurnOnLaserPulsing();

Enable the laser pulse.

TurnOffLaserPulsing
call Laser.TurnOffLaserPulsing();

Disable the laser pulse.

SetLaserReprate
call Laser.SetLaserReprate(
value
);

Sets the laser rep rate in Hz.  The software automatically converts this into a rep rate, which is what is actually provided to the laser.

Parameters
value

the desired rep rate, in Hz.

GetPulsingEnabled
call Laser.GetPulsingEnabled(
&isenabled
);

Query the status of laser pulsing.

Response Parameters

If enabled, 1.  Otherwise, 0.

SetLaserPowerAsPercentage
call Laser.SetLaserPowerAsPercentage(
value
);

Sets the laser power as a percentage.

Parameters
value

the desired power percentage

GetLaserPowerAsPercentage
call Laser.GetLaserPowerAsPercentage(
&value
);

Query the current percentage power of the laser.

Response Parameters
&value

the current power percentage

SetDivider
call Laser.SetDivider(
value
);

Set the pulse picker divider

Parameters
value

the desired pulse divider

GetDivider
call Laser.GetDivider(
&value
);

Get the current pulse picker divider.  Only valid if the laser is actively pulsing.

Response Parameters
&value

the current pulse picker divider

GetReprate
call Laser.GetReprate(
&value
);

Gets the current rep rate.  Only valid if the laser is actively pulsing.

Response Parameters
&value

the current rep rate in Hz.
